title: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2016 Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Spiced red apple and stone fruit aromas carry to the ripe, juicy palate. There's an attractive roundness adding weight, with a bit of residual sugar to help prop up the fruit flavors, ultimately this is a simple, off-dry pour.

title: Trinitas 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: This extravagantly woody wine has spicy, almost sweet aromas of cedar and pine followed by flavors like strawberry and blackberry jam. The texture is very smooth.

title: Apothic 2016 White (California)
description: Light peach and apple aromas lead to ripe sweet melon and peach flavors and a soft smooth texture. It's an easygoing fruit-forward off-dry wine.

title: Argami 2016 Old Vines Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Yeasty but generic white-fruit aromas come with a hint of vanilla cookie. This feels angular and acidic, not full and complete. Citrus flavors are both briny and sour, while this tastes salty on the finish.

title: Bodegas Fariña 2012 Dama de Toro Crianza  (Toro)
description: Heavy oak results in aromas of maple, clove and wood resin. On the palate, this is sticky and chewy, with rough tannins. Much like this smells, it tastes of wood, clove and milk chocolate more than clean fruit. A spicy clove-driven finish is dense and cheesy.

title: Château Borie de Noaillan 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: A light wine, this is tight with fruit, acidity and a mineral edge. The wine also has perfume and a touch of spice that gives it extra interest and balance. Drink now.

title: Château d'Haurets 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Bright and fruity, this light, fresh wine is ready to drink. It has an easy character, light fruit and refreshing crispness.

title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Rich pear flavors dominate this ripe, full wine. It has touches of spice as well as the rich fruit, perfumed and generous. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2017 Cuvée des Princes Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: A simple, soft blend from the south of France, this is a perfect apéritif—bright and crisp with acidity. It's fresh, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Chateau St. Jean 2016 Crisp Chardonnay (California)
description: Very ripe and fruity in flavor, this medium-bodied wine is soft in texture, full of peach and pear notes and a bit sweet on the finish.

title: Château Terrebonne 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This gentle wine offers plenty of red-berry fruits. The acidity is contrasted with the spicy, peppery character and the ripe fruitiness that gives a soft aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Colognola 2013 Labieno Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: Made from late-harvested grapes, this has seen better days. While it barely expresses aroma, the hefty palate offers faint suggestions of toasted almond, kerosene and dried yellow stone fruit. Despite its tangy acidity, the fruit has largely dried up, leaving an abrupt finish and the heat of evident alcohol, further throwing it off balance.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Creekbend 2013 Sparkling Vidal Blanc (Indiana Uplands)
description: This deep-gold colored sparkler displays aromas of ripe yellow peach, tangerine, lemon tart and orange blossoms. The palate is thick and the bubbles feel weighed down, showing flavors of buttery oak and vanilla over peach, cashew and graham cracker flavors. The medium-length finish features fresh apricot and peach clafoutis.

title: Domaine Proux 2016 Rosé (Var)
description: This soft, fruity wine has attractive red fruits, a gentle, generous texture and light acidity. The combination makes for a warm wine, full of sunshine and ready to drink.

title: Europa Village 2015 C'est La Vie Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Lighter in color and shy on the nose, this bottling eventually allows aromas of red-plum balsamic sauce and herbs to arise. The palate shows loads of fennel pollen, dust and earth, with a touch of red fruit. It's varietally confusing.

title: Il Palazzo 2016  Chianti
description: Scorched earth aromas, a whiff of underbrush and a toasted note lead the nose of this wine. The ripe and simple palate offers fleshy wild cherry and orange zest flavors alongside fleeting tannins.

title: Kestrel 2013 Super Yakimae Red (Yakima Valley)
description: The anise, cranberry, cherry and spice aromas seem a bit dried out. The cranberry and raspberry flavors are soft and light, with medicinal flavors on the finish.

title: Les Vins Bréban 2017 Yes Way Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: This soft caramel- and red fruit-flavored wine is just lightly crisp at the end. It has an attractive juicy strawberry flavor, cut by just the right amount of acidity. Drink now.

title: Lone Birch 2016 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas offer notes of canned peach, apple and spice that are followed by off-dry fruit flavors. It's a straightforward easy drinker.

title: Louis Bernard 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Pink in color, and light in flavor, this is a simple, fruity wine. It has a refreshing character along with a tangy edge of acidity that gives the wine a lift. Drink now.

title: Mirabeau 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Full of bright, ripe strawberry flavors and smooth acidity, this is a rich style of rosé, fruity while also having a soft texture and a full aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Raphael 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (New York)
description: Spring flowers, cranberry and a hint of anise gently waft from the glass. The palate is light in feel and mildly citric, ending on a soft red berry tone.

title: Rosemont 2017 Traminette (Virginia)
description: This wine is heavily perfumed in tones of white peach, lychee, white grape and rose essence. On the palate the flavors translate as soapy and the body is quite full on this dry expression of the varietal. The finish is long yet disconnected.

title: Ty Caton 2014 Entycement Red (Sonoma County)
description: This blends Zinfandel, Syrah, Sangiovese, Merlot, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon in a kitchen-sink offering of overripe baked flavors and aromas. Sweet cherry and vanilla highlight thick extracted layers that end simply.

title: Willowbrook 2015 Harris-Kratka Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is earthy and herbal with a persistently tart tannic personality that's hard to crack. Full bodied and ripe, it finishes short and quick.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Lanius Organic White (Alella)
description: A heavy coating of oak aromas gives this midlevel white blend a resiny outlook. In the mouth, this is medium in body but flabby due to low acidity. A flavor profile based mostly on oak includes notes of popcorn and butter, while this is woody and less than precise on the finish.

title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Brut Rosé (California)
description: This very approachable wine has fresh and peachy aromas, slightly sweet flavors like cotton candy and a smooth frothy texture. It's easy to sip and easy to like, especially at this price.

title: Bedell 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Shy notes of citrus peel and grass carry the nose and palate. This is straightforward, light-bodied and crisp, making it an easy wine to enjoy by itself.

title: Bellini 2016  Chianti Classico
description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, cooking spices and dark fruit appear in this informal red. The simple palate shows dark berry and star anise flavors alongside loose-knit, fleeting tannins. Drink soon.

title: Benmarl 2016 Stainless Steel Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: A simple, straightforward nose of apple and citrus carries to the light- to medium-bodied palate. It's enjoyable in its transparency and a perfect crowd pleaser.
